intro: Spiesia recognita, commonly known as the narrowleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its small yellow flowers are clustered in complex inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Spiesia recognita is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
